Hello blank fragment

This app will help you lower your cigarette consumption, even quit smoking, with the help of scientific papers from universities or online researches.\n \nFor you to have better results and the results that the app is giving, you must lower you consumption 50% and maintain it as long as you can.
Smoking cigarettes is expensive. Use our calculator to find out how much money you spend in cigarettes.

string.name: Intro_String
string.b: Welcome to Quit Smoking Now app. This app will help you lower your cigarette consumption, even quit smoking, with the help of specific scientific papers.

resources.string: Welcome\nThis is a bachelor\'s thesis app,\n created for the University of Peloponnese

This app will help you lower your cigarette consumption and even quit smoking, with the help of scientific papers from universities, researches and researchers papers.\n \nTo have better results both to yourself and in the app, you must lower your consumption by 50% and maintain it as long as you can.
About
How many cigarettes do you smoke per day?
How much do you pay per pack?
Here goes how much
The links for the papers, are below for you to see:
Did you smoke any cigarettes today?
Did you accidentally click more? Subtract one.
Subtraction
This is a channel description

This is a cravings timer.
 This timer will help you resist smoking for
 4 minutes
 when you have cravings.
Begin
Reset
EXAMPLE
Configure
Add widget
This is an app widget description
This is the Spending tab. Here you can calculate how much you spend per day, week and month.
This is the Cravings tab. if you feel the need to smoke a cigarette, please don\'t, use apps craving tab.
This is the Home tab. Here you can click the cigarette when you smoke a cigarette.
This is the Result tab. Here you can see your daily results depending your daily consumption from Home Tab.
This is the About tab. Here you can see the links of the scientific papers with which the app is made.
Here you can see your results, depending on your daily cigarette consumption.\n\nPlease wait, be patient and the app will notify you about the results.
Please use full stop \".\", instead of comma \",\" .

Your today\’s consumption is higher than yesterdays. You have to make the decision, to stop smoking. Please, consult the papers from About tab about daily consumption and the effects on health and if you have cravings use the timer from Cravings tab. From here on out, try lowering your cigarette consumption. In-depth time, increasing consumption, depending on your health condition you will have:

• 1.04–1.11 times having cancer in general from a non-smoker
\n• 8.08–12.17 times having bronchus and lung cancer
\n• 3.16–8.44 times having larynx cancer
\n• 1.85–4.32 times having liver cancer
\n• 1.71–2.63 times having lip, oral cavity and pharynx cancer
\n• 1.57–2.46 times having esophagus cancer
\n• 1.34–2.49 times having pancreas cancer
\n• Higher chances for ischemic heart diseases
Description

Your today\'s consumption is less than yesterdays. This is a small step towards the goal. Please, try your best to reduce the amount of cigarettes you smoke or stop smoking. Also, ask your doctor for advice before doing everything, you can use treatments such as:

• Skin patches which release nicotine slowly
\n• Chewing gum
\n• Inhalators, which look like plastic cigarettes
\n • Tablets
\n• Mouth spray
Description
Your today\'s consumption is the same with yesterdays.\n Your effort is not achievable enough to match with your goals. Smoking the same amount won\'t help you, so try harder.
Congratulations. You didn\'t smoke any cigarettes today. This is a major step for you and your health. Maintain it and you won\'t have to smoke ever again.\n If you won\'t smoke for long enough:

• After 20 minutes quitting smoking your blood pressure will drop to normal levels decreasing heart risks
\n• You will notice that the food tastes better
\n• Your breath, hair and clothes will smell better
\n• You will break an addiction cycle
\n• You will improve your night vision and help preserve your overall vision by stopping the damage that smoking does to your eyes
\n• Not smoking will keep your mouth healthy for years to come
\n• You will prevent any type of cancer
This is your first time receiving results, you should better start fresh tomorrow.
